DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Substance Morphology Noncontrast-enhancing Tissue (nCET) Proportion Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Proportion of the entire tumor is estimated to represent nonenhancing tumor or nCET (not edema).  Non-enhancing tumor (nCET) is defined as regions of T2W hyperintensity (less than the intensity of cerebrospinal fluid, with corresponding T1W hypointensity) that are associated with mass effect and architectural distortion, including blurring of the gray-white interface.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lesion Substance Morphology Noncontrast-enhancing Tissue (nCET) Proportion
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A part or fraction of an area of abnormal tissue change characterized by increased visibly of abnormal tissue on a magnetic resonance image (MRI) or computed tomography (CT) that does not enhance with contast and is not edema.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.:A material with particular features.:Morphology is the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.

The science of the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.  In pathology, the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) under the light or electron microscope.

Property.preferredDefinition: Visibly abnormal tissue on a magnetic resonance image (MRI) or computed tomography (CT) that does not enhance with contast and is not edema.:A part, fraction, share, or number considered in relation to the whole amount or number.

Concepts.definition: Visibly abnormal tissue on a magnetic resonance image (MRI) or computed tomography (CT) that does not enhance with contrast and is not edema.
A part, fraction, share, or number considered in relation to the whole amount or number.

ReferenceDocuments.name: VASARI
ReferenceDocuments.description: Assuming that the the entire abnormality may be comprised of: (1) an enhancing component, (2) a non-enhancing component, (3) a necrotic component and (4) a edema component.

ReferenceDocuments.name: VASARI Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: When scanning through the entire tumor volume, what proportion of the entire tumor is estimated to represent nonenhancing tumor or nCET (not edema)?

DataElement.changeDescription: 1/23/13 jc  CDE released.  1/18/13 jc  CDE versioned to support revised response values defined in VASARI v3.0 Features Key.   6/22/09 created for VASARI F6 feature item
